intro: Gynura villosa, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Gynura villosa typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can be found in forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
